I am writing a review about a family staying here. This place is absolutely lovely!! We loved the location right in the downtown walking distance to so many things! We enjoyed our stay here immensely as a family.
The owner spared no expense in renovating this property, it has beautiful leather chairs, lovely custom cabinetry, high end appliances, and it's very tastefully decorated. The bathroom upstairs in the master is spa-like. Very relaxing! We have teenagers and a two-year-old. There are a few things I would consider if I was coming here with a young child. The Master suite is upstairs as well as a loft area with beautiful iron horizontal railing. It also has two long sets of staircases. If you have a child just learning to walk, or one that likes climbing, you may want to wait to enjoy this wonderful property!
Overall, it was an amazing experience. We had returned to Chillicothe after spending a weekend here last year. It's such a fun experience. The children love Grandpa Joe's candy store, seeing the 50th annual Tecumseh outdoor drama, I love Rost coffee, and the old canal smokehouse has some amazing food! We will be back, maybe we have to make it an annual event.

This is an architecturally beautiful and very clean home. The hostess left a nice plate of treats and a welcome note. While we mostly enjoyed our stay, in fairness to you, the reader of this review and as a potential future guests, we feel compelled to provide full disclosure based on the listing and our own experience at the time. Unfortunately, the listing is inaccurate and/or misleading, in our opinion, based on our own experience and in part due to our own fault for making assumptions based on the listing's pictures and list of amenities.
1) The listing shows pictures of three bedrooms, while there are in fact only 2 for 4 guests, in only full-sized beds. The verbage does state 2 bedrooms & no indication of the size of these beds, other than the pictures. (Our own fault for not questioning the inconsistency between the pictures and the words.)
2) The listing says check-in at 3 PM, but we received a text while we were already mid-air in our flight that it was at 4 pm. (We were able to enter shortly after 3, and assume that the Ring doorbell allowed the hostess to see us & grant remote access. ) Please note that the listing indicates that it is on you as the guest to initiate contact with the hostess, which we did very early that morning.
2) The absolute biggest shock was that this place is apparently the owners' residence and that her two large and very sweet dogs were in the back yard! (There was a note from the hostess which said not to enter the area.) This is the area we had expected to be able to use per the listing... (barbecue, fire pit, etc.) We had envisioned sitting around the fire pit and barbecuing while visiting. We very much enjoyed the fire island on the front porch, but the busy traffic and smaller area was an issue.
3) Very minor inconsistencies, to us, included parking (on street vs on site, depending on where you read what...), availability of bicycles, availability of higher-end hair care products and availability of a blow-dryer.
It's really what matters to you, so what we found to be issues may not matter to you.

All in all not a bad stay. Just make sure it fits your needs before booking.
